md:
giải nghĩa từ "lubricate" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* Lubricate (verb) /luːˈbrɪkeɪt/:
	+ Meaning: to make something smooth and slippery by putting a substance on it, so that it can move easily.
	+ Vietnamese: bôi trơn, làm trơn.
	+ Example sentence: "You need to lubricate the hinges of the door so that it can open smoothly."
	+ Related words: lubricant, lubrication, slippery, smooth.
	+ Antonyms: dry, rough, sticky.

* Lubricate (verb) /luːˈbrɪkeɪt/:
	+ Meaning: to make something or someone more acceptable or pleasant by saying or doing something flattering or charming.
	+ Vietnamese: lấy lòng, làm vừa lòng.
	+ Example sentence: "The politician tried to lubricate the crowd with his charming speech."
	+ Related words: flatter, charm, please, appease.
	+ Antonyms: offend, annoy, irritate.

Note: The second meaning of "lubricate" is more figurative and less common than the first meaning.
